title: 4 Ways to Cook Mixed Vegetables (Sauté, Roast, Grill, & Steam)

steps.title: Sauté the onion for one minute over medium heat.
steps.content: Sauté the onion for one minute over medium heat. Pour 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of extra-virgin olive oil into a large skillet. Turn the heat on medium and mince one small shallot while the oil heats up. Add the shallot to the oil and stir it as it sautés. Cook the shallot for one minute so it softens. [1] X Research source You can substitute canola, peanut, corn, safflower, or soybean oil for the extra-virgin olive oil.

steps.title: Stir in the frozen mixed vegetables.
steps.content: Stir in the frozen mixed vegetables. Measure 4 cups (600 g) of mixed frozen vegetables into the skillet with the shallot. There's no need to thaw the vegetables before you stir them into the shallot. [2] X Research source You can use the classic mixed blend of frozen vegetables or your favorite frozen combination of vegetables (such as stir fry blend or California blend).

steps.title: Cook the vegetables for four to six minutes.
steps.content: Cook the vegetables for four to six minutes. Put the lid on the skillet. Cook the vegetables for four to six minutes so they're completely heated. [3] X Research source You can stir the vegetables once or twice to ensure that they sauté evenly.

steps.title: Season the sautéed mixed vegetables and serve them.
steps.content: Season the sautéed mixed vegetables and serve them. Take the lid off of the skillet and sprinkle ½ teaspoon (0.5 g) of dried dill or tarragon, ¼ teaspoon (1.5 g) of salt, and ¼ teaspoon (0.5 g) of freshly ground pepper over the vegetables. Stir the mixed vegetables and serve them. [4] X Research source Store the leftover mixed vegetables in an airtight container in the refrigerator for three to four days.

steps.title: Preheat the oven and slice the onion.
steps.content: Preheat the oven and slice the onion. Turn the oven on to 375 degrees F (180 degrees C). Peel one medium-sized onion and cut it into four large wedges. Slice each wedge into very thin slices (about one centimeter or 0.4-inch thick). Scatter the sliced onion across the bottom of a large baking dish. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Wash and dice the remaining vegetables.
steps.content: Wash and dice the remaining vegetables. Wash the rest of the vegetables and trim off the ends. Use a sharp knife to dice the vegetables into cubes that are about the same size to ensure that they roast evenly. Dice the vegetables to pieces that are smaller than 1/2-inch (12-mm). [6] X Research source Keep in mind that you can remove or swap out any of the vegetables in this recipe. The important thing is that you keep the amount of vegetables the same. For example, if you don't want to use the bell peppers and eggplant, use extra potatoes, zucchini, or tomatoes.

steps.title: Combine and season the vegetables in a baking dish.
steps.content: Combine and season the vegetables in a baking dish. Place the diced vegetables into the baking dish with the onion. Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste. You should also sprinkle your favorite herbs to taste. [7] X Research source Consider using dried sage, thyme, or rosemary.

steps.title: Pour oil over the vegetables and stir them.
steps.content: Pour oil over the vegetables and stir them. Pour 4 to 5 tablespoons (60 to 74 ml) of olive oil over the vegetables and toss the mixture until it's combined. [8] X Research source You can substitute canola, peanut, corn, safflower, or soybean oil for the extra-virgin olive oil.

steps.title: Roast the vegetables for 45 to 60 minutes.
steps.content: Roast the vegetables for 45 to 60 minutes. Put the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake the vegetables for 30 minutes. Stir the vegetables and then roast the vegetables for another 15 to 30 minutes. They should soften and become golden brown once they've finished roasting. Serve the roasted mixed vegetables once they've cooled a little. [9] X Research source While you can store the roasted mixed vegetables in an airtight container in the refrigerator for three to five days, they will become soft over time.

steps.title: Combine the seasonings.
steps.content: Combine the seasonings. Get out a small bowl and mix together 1 tablespoon (12.5 g) of light brown sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons (1 g) of fresh basil leaves, 1/2 teaspoon (3 g) of salt, 1/2 teaspoon (1.5 g) of garlic powder, and 1/8 teaspoon (0.3 g) of ground black pepper. Set the seasonings aside. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Wash and cut the vegetables.
steps.content: Wash and cut the vegetables. Trim the ends off of eight asparagus spears. Remove the seeds from one medium red bell pepper and cut the pepper into six large strips. You'll also need to slice one medium zucchini, one medium yellow squash, and one small red onion into 1/2-inch (12-mm) slices. Place all of the cut vegetables into a large mixing bowl. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Toss the vegetables with the seasoning and oil.
steps.content: Toss the vegetables with the seasoning and oil. Pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil and the seasoning mixture over the mixed vegetables. Use a spoon to mix the oil and seasonings over the vegetables until they're evenly coated. This will prevent them from sticking to the grill or grill basket. [12] X Research source You can substitute canola, peanut, corn, safflower, or soybean oil for the extra-virgin olive oil. Keep in mind that you can remove or swap out any of the vegetables in this recipe. The important thing is that you keep the amount of vegetables the same. For example, you could leave out the asparagus, but use more zucchini or add large mushrooms instead.

steps.title: Skewer the vegetables.
steps.content: Skewer the vegetables. Poke each vegetable onto metal skewers and place them on the grill. You can mix the vegetables to get some variety on each skewer or make skewers with just one type of vegetable. If you don't want to skewer the veggies, just spread the mixed vegetables in a grill basket. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Grill the vegetables for 10 to 12 minutes.
steps.content: Grill the vegetables for 10 to 12 minutes. If you're using skewers, turn them once or twice so they cook evenly. If you're using the grill basket, flip them once as they cook. The grilled vegetables should be soft and lightly charred. Serve the mixed vegetables after they've cooled for a minute. [14] X Research source Wear oven mitts or use tongs to remove the skewers from the grill since the metal will heat up. Store the leftover grilled vegetables in an airtight container in the refrigerator. The vegetables will soften the longer they're stored, so use them within a few days.

steps.title: Set up your steamer and steaming liquid.
steps.content: Set up your steamer and steaming liquid. Pour 2 cups (480 ml) of chicken or vegetable stock into a pot. Place a steamer basket into the pot and turn the heat to medium. The stock should heat up while you prepare the vegetables. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Wash and cut the vegetables.
steps.content: Wash and cut the vegetables. Cut the broccoli into florets and trim the string beans. Chop the cabbage into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces and chop the carrots into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces. Trim the ends off of the zucchini and slice it into 1/2-inch (12 mm) slices. [16] X Research source If you like, you can cut the zucchini slices in half to make half-moon shapes. You can remove or swap out any of the vegetables in this recipe. The important thing is that you keep the amount of vegetables the same. For example, if you could leave out the broccoli and use brussels sprouts instead.

steps.title: Put the vegetables in the basket and increase the heat.
steps.content: Put the vegetables in the basket and increase the heat. Place all of the mixed vegetables into the steamer basket. Turn the heat up to medium-high and bring the steaming liquid to a boil. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Cover and steam the vegetables for five minutes.
steps.content: Cover and steam the vegetables for five minutes. Put the lid on the pot and turn the heat down to low. Steam the vegetables in the basket for five minutes. Carefully lift the vegetable basket out of the pot and ensure that they're tender before you serve them. [18] X Research source Store the leftover mixed vegetables in an airtight container in the refrigerator for three to four days.
